intro: Borreria compressa, commonly known as the narrowleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Borreria compressa is well adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
